intro: Pardoglossum atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic marsh orchid, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in salt marshes and tidal flats. The plant features elongated, grass-like leaves and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink and white. Its root system is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding and salinity. Pardoglossum atlanticum plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
